answers.answer: Hi sorry about your problems.  Have you been eating differently lately.  Was your thyroid ever check for overactive thryoid disease.  this too can cause anxiety and since you already are a little anxious this can add to it.  I hope soon whatever makes you so anxious will disappear.  No one should be that anxious all the time.  My husband tends to be anxious and I am always there to talk him out of it.  I hope you can have the same support even if its from strangers.

i have support i also take prosac and klonipin for anxiety but waiting to find out if i'm being put in the hospital just isnt right they should let you know that right away.  diet hasn't changed.  It just hurts when i eat.I was put on zelnorm but my mother who is a pharmacist said that it wouldn't cause me to lose any weight.So i'm at a loss because my thryoid is normal.......:shrugs: thanks for the reply though...

What part hurts when you eat?  Have you been checked for diabetes too? Did they do the full thyroid bloodwork on you?  Many times when tested for thyroid disfunctions people get the cheaper test done and there are many false results. What looks to be normal on one test shows up abnormal on the expensive test.  Ask your doctor if you got the more thorough test done w/ t3,t4 tsh & all that. Don't be affraid to go to the hospital, there maybe many tests done but mainly they want to be able to give you nutritian by way of IV. Just bring some favorite reading material or music w/earplugs and enough battery power, playing cards or a handheld game (that the sound can be shut off on)you don't want to disturb any neighbors. Put in all in a lockable case for safety when you're not in the room. Hospitals don't want to be liable for "misplaced" personal items. Pray your way through any scarey stuff and enjoy the peace that comes over you.  Good luck and fast healing.
